duties_responsibilities.duty: Drive sales in assigned territory and engage with customers both face to face and virtually
Develop and implement effective business and territory call plans; effectively identify and implement live/virtual engagement strategies with customers to maximize overall effectiveness and impact
Build rapport and relationships with customers in live and virtual environments; effectively use existing and ever-changing digital tools for successful customer engagement
Understand and leverage internal reports and analytics to identify, develop, and implement strategic business opportunities

Leverage product and disease state knowledge to educate providers on unbranded and branded product value proposition for relevant patient populations; strategically utilize approved clinically oriented disease state information and patient resources
Collaborate effectively and compliantly across the organization to address customer inquiries and advance Pfizer objectives; complete all administrative expectations on time and compliantly

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Business, or a related field (Master's preferred)

Minimum 2 years of experience in professional sales or promotional activity, small business ownership, marketing, customer service and account management, relevant healthcare/scientific roles (e.g., RN, Pharmacist, PT, OT, etc.), educator, and full-time military experience
